channel.title: How should the time be set when using Tor before VPN?
channel.description:
I followed the guide http://www.dds6qkxpwdeubwucdiaord2xgbbeyds25rbsgr73tbfpqpt4a6vjwsyd.onion/wiki/Tunnels/Connecting_to_Tor_before_a_VPN
In the "Deactivate Miscellaneous Proxy Settings" section it says "For some applications, this is impossible: sdwdate". So I assume this means that sdwdate no longer works in this configuration. How should I be setting the time so that it is in sync with the VPN's time? Should I install ntp? When I checked one of the recommended leak test sites http://check2ip.com/ there was warning message of a time mismatch.

item.title: How should the time be set when using Tor before VPN?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Did you read this page yet?

Whonix – 3 Nov 19

Tunnels/Introduction

Instructions on how to combine tunnels (VPN, SSH, proxy) with Tor. (User → Tor → proxy/VPN/SSH → Internet) (User → proxy/VPN/SSH → Tor → Internet)

Maybe that page can help to discourage any considerations of using any VPNs.

ArtfulCity:

In the “Deactivate Miscellaneous Proxy Settings” section it says “For some applications, this is impossible: sdwdate”.

When you dig a deep hole, jump in and then ask why things don’t look sunny from down there so to speak…

ArtfulCity:

How should I be setting the time so that it is in sync with the VPN’s time?

This presupposes a probably incorrect assumption.
How do I set my time being sync with my Tor exit relay?
How do I set my time being sync with my ISP?
No need to bother.

ArtfulCity:

Should I install ntp?

No -> https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/TimeSync#NTP

ArtfulCity:

When I checked one of the recommended leak test sites http://check2ip.com/ there was warning message of a time mismatch.

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Browser_Tests#Interpreting_Test_Results applies.

Read full topic
item.source: How should the time be set when using Tor before VPN?
